poem:
### The Summit

Silver tongues convene,
in dim-lit rooms where hopes 
like pennies in a jar,
rattle. 

Promises unearthed,
each note—a heartbeat out of sync,
with budget's relentless clock. 

Costs rise, the sky lowers,
ideas like clipped wings
flutter and fall—

Investment, a distant star,
shining over empty streets,
each look a muted hope.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
